A lot longer than episode one but still shorter than Half-Life 2, the ending is the biggest cliffhanger I've ever seen. The gameplay, especially towards the end, is very satisfying and rewarding. Great game!

The best Half-Life yet (though I haven't played Alyx), and the best shooter I have ever played. The physics are fun, the story engages, and the combat and exploration are open-ended while delivering the liner narrative masterfully. Finishing it disappointed me, but only because I know there is little chance of a Half-Life 3 to finish the story, or even an Episode 3. One can dream.

This one is my favorite HL2 game. It feels like this one had more focus and direction as to what it wanted to do for the Half Life universe.

There's more of a story here, and the gameplay was pretty good! There was never a dull moment in this episode. I didn't like the heavy use of the car during the second half, but I have never liked first person vehicle controls in any game. I also quite enjoyed the new Hunter enemy, and the Antlion nest was my favorite area too!

And dang, now I understand why people want Half Life 3 now. I was okay leaving the story at 2, but since episodes 1 and 2 are a thing, it really is left unfinished now.

I didn't score episode 1 in that review since it didn't feel significant enough to rate it on it's own merits, but this one absolutely is. So I will retroactively score episode 1 a 5/10 and score episode 2 an 7/10.
Now we just need Half Life 3

Half-Life 2 Episode 2 continues to meet the already incredibly high standard for the series, there is not a single part of this game that is subpar, everything is great or better and it is a very enjoyable game. It is such a shame we migh never see the end of the trilogy.

OK, so SPOILER ALERT





there is a major cliffhanger that will probably never be concluded ---- but I would still recommend this game to other players.

Half Life 2, but the third one.

Half Life 2 Episode 2 is an incredible game. While being a lot shorter than Half Life 2 it hits a lot more marks than Episode 1 making it just as good as Half Life 2 in many regards. The story is incredible and has a lot less downtime and more exhilarating set pieces than Episode 1. As you travel across the Eastern European countryside you go through a mine where a new enemy type is introduced and then you travel to the resistance base in a car. The music is the kind of music that you expect from a Half Life game and really helps pump up the action in the parts where it's needed and give you chills when you're going down a dark hallway full of zombies. [spoiler] The end is a fight to hold off the combine forces until you can launch a missile to close the Combine portal [/spoiler] and when you think it's over the game leaves you with the biggest cliffhanger of all. Now I know why everyone wants Episode 3 or Half Life 3. So once again I recommend this legendary series to anyone who wants an enthralling world, gripping story, and intense action.
